children.name: toOccurrence
Example - create occurrence from a scheduler event

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: Additional options passed to the SchedulerEvent constructor.> `uid` property of the event will be preserved.

children.description: Converts the scheduler event to a event occurrence. Method will remove `recurrenceRule`, `recurrenceException` options, will add a `recurrenceId` field and will set `id` to the default one.

children.name: isRecurrenceHead
Example - check whether an event is a recurrence head

children.description: Checks whether the event is the head of a recurring series.

children.name: isRecurring
Example - check whether an event is an occurrence

children.description: Checks whether the event is part of a recurring series.

children.name: isOccurrence
Example - check whether an event is an occurrence

children.description: Checks whether the event is an occurrence part of a recurring series.

children.name: isException
Example - check whether an event is an exception

children.description: Checks whether the event is a recurrence exception.

children.name: isMultiDay
Example - check whether an event is a multi-day event

children.description: Checks whether the event is equal to or longer then twenty four hours.

children.name: update

parameters.name: eventInfo `Object`
parameters.description: The new values, which will be used to update the event.

children.description: Updates the scheduler event.

children.name: expand

parameters.name: timeZoneId `String`
parameters.description: The time zone ID used to convert the recurrence rule dates.

parameters.name: end `Date`
parameters.description: The end date of the occurrence period.

parameters.name: start `Date`
parameters.description: The start date of the occurrence period.

children.description: Expands the event for a specific period based on the `recurrenceRule` option.

children.name: duration
Example - get length of the event

children.description: Returns the scheduler event length in milliseconds.

children.name: clone
Example - override start and end dates of the event

parameters.name: updateUid `Boolean`*(default: false)*
parameters.description: If you pass `true` the `uid` of the event will be **updated**.

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: Additional options passed to the SchedulerEvent constructor.

children.description: Clones the scheduler event.

children.name: SchedulerEvent.define

parameters.name: options.fields.fieldName.validation `Object`
parameters.description: Specifies the validation options which will be used by [Kendo Validator](/api/framework/validator).

parameters.name: options.fields.fieldName.type `String`
parameters.description: Specifies the the type of the field. The available options are `"string"`, `"number"`, `"boolean"`, `"date`". The default is `"string"`.

parameters.name: options.fields.fieldName.parse `Function`
parameters.description: Specifies the function which will parse the field value. If not set default parsers will be used.

parameters.name: options.fields.fieldName.nullable `Boolean`
parameters.description: Specifies if the `defaultValue` setting should be used. The default is `false`.

parameters.name: options.fields.fieldName.editable `Boolean`
parameters.description: Specifies if the field is editable or not. The default value is `true`.

parameters.name: options.fields.fieldName.defaultValue
parameters.description: Specifies the which will be used for the field when a new model instance is created. Default settings depend on the type of the field. Default for "string" is `""`,for "number" is `0` and for "date" is `new Date()` (today).

parameters.name: options.fields `Object`
parameters.description: A set of key/value pairs the configure the model fields. The key specifies the name of the field.Quote the key if it contains spaces or other symbols which are not valid for a JavaScript identifier.

parameters.name: options.id `String`
parameters.description: The name of the field which acts as an identifier of the scheduler event.The identifier is used to determine if a model instance is new or existing one.If the value of the field specified is equal to the default value (specified through the `fields` configuration) the model is considered as new.

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: Describes the configuration options of the new scheduler event class.

children.description: Defines a new `SchedulerEvent` type using the provided options.

children.name: Example - get the event start timezone
Example - get the event start date
Example - get the event recurrence rule
Example - get the event recurrence parent id
Example - get the event recurrence exception field
Example - get the event isAllDay field
Example - get the event end timezone
Example - get the event end date
title
Example - set the title of an event

children.description: The title of the event which is displayed by the scheduler widget.

children.name: startTimezone
Example - set the end timezone of an event

children.description: The timezone of the `start` date. If not specified the [timezone](/api/javascript/ui/scheduler#configuration-timezone) will be used.The complete list of the supported timezones is available in the [List of IANA time zones](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_IANA_time_zones) Wikipedia page.

children.name: start
Example - set the start date of an event

children.description: The date at which the scheduler event starts. The `start` date is mandatory.

children.name: recurrenceRule
children.description: The recurrence rule describing the recurring pattern of the event. The format follows the [iCal specification](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545).

children.name: recurrenceId
children.description: The `id` of the recurrence parent event. Required for events that are recurrence exceptions.

children.name: recurrenceException
children.description: The recurrence exceptions. A list of semi-colon separated dates formatted using the `yyyyMMddTHHmmssZ` format string.> **Important**: The dates should be encoded in UTC.

children.name: isAllDay
children.description: If set to `true` the event is "all day". By default events are not all day.> **Important**: When `isAllDay` is set to `true` the `start` and `end` fields must be set to the same date.

children.name: id
Example - set the identifier of an event

children.description: The mandatory unique identifier of the event.

children.name: endTimezone
Example - set the end timezone of an event

children.description: The timezone of the `end` date. If not specified the [timezone](/api/javascript/ui/scheduler#configuration-timezone) will be used.The complete list of the supported timezones is available in the [List of IANA time zones](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_IANA_time_zones) Wikipedia page.

children.name: end
Example - set the end date of an event

children.description: The date at which the scheduler event ends. The `end` date is mandatory.

children.name: description
Example - set the description of an event

children.description: The optional event description.
